meanings.sent1: She tends to overween and boast about her achievements.
meanings.sent2: He doesn't overween about his abilities; he is humble.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to overween when it caught a small mouse.
meanings.sent4: His overweening attitude made him blind to his own faults.
meanings.sent5: The overweening peacock strutted around the farmyard, showing off its feathers.

meanings.definition: To have an excessive amount of confidence.
meanings.sent1: Despite his lack of experience, he tends to overween in his skills.
meanings.sent2: It's good to have confidence, but don't overween and underestimate the challenge.
meanings.sent3: The little ant seemed to overween as it tried to lift a huge crumb.
meanings.sent4: Her overweening belief in her luck led her to take unnecessary risks.
meanings.sent5: The overweening athlete was sure he would win the race, but he came in last.

meanings.definition: To think too highly of oneself.
meanings.sent1: She tends to overween and believe she is better than everyone else.
meanings.sent2: It's important not to overween and become disconnected from reality.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to overween as it chattered proudly about its nut collection.
meanings.sent4: His overweening pride prevented him from accepting help when he needed it.
meanings.sent5: The overweening king believed no one could match his greatness, but his people disagreed.
